Class ResUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ntechniks.nstudios.androidutils.ResUtils

  • public class ResUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to help various Resource file manipulations.

    • Method Detail

      • unpackZipResourceByName

        public static void unpackZipResourceByName(android.content.Context context,
                                           java.lang.String destFolder,
                                           java.lang.String resName,
                                           @Nullable
                                           java.lang.String permissions)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Unpacking a zip file stored as a application resource file. By specifying the recourse name it will load the zip file and will unzip it into specific directory.
        Parameters:
        context - Context - The current context.
        destFolder - String - The directory path to the destination.
        resName - String - The resource name of the file.
        permissions - String - In case the files don't exist, it will create new file or dir with the following permissions attribute.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - In case the file was not found.
        android.content.res.Resources.NotFoundException - - In case the resource was not found.
        java.io.IOException - - In case there was read/write problem during unpacking.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - IllegalAccessException -
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • unpackZipResource

        public static void unpackZipResource(@RawRes
                                     int id,
                                     android.content.Context context,
                                     @Nullable
                                     java.lang.String destFolder,
                                     @Nullable
                                     java.lang.String permissions,
                                     boolean shouldOverride)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Unpacking a zip file stored as a application resource file. By specifying the recourse ID it will load the zip file and will unzip it into specific directory.
        Parameters:
        id - int - The resource id of the file.
        context - Context - The current context.
        destFolder - String - The directory path to the destination.
        permissions - String - In case the files don't exist, it will create new file or dir with the following permissions attribute.
        shouldOverride - boolean - Should override the destination files if already exist.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - In case the file was not found.
        android.content.res.Resources.NotFoundException - - In case the resource was not found.
        java.io.IOException - - In case there was read/write problem during unpacking.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - IllegalAccessException -
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • unpackZipFile

        public static void unpackZipFile(@Nullable
                                 java.lang.String destFolder,
                                 java.io.FileInputStream fis,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.lang.String permissions,
                                 boolean shouldOverride)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Unpacking a zip file stored as a local file. By specifying the file input stream it will load the zip file and will unzip it into specific directory.
        Parameters:
        destFolder - String - The directory path to the destination.
        fis - FileInputStream - Input stream to the zip file.
        permissions - String - In case the files don't exist, it will create new file or dir with the following permissions attribute.
        shouldOverride - boolean - Should override the destination files if already exist.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - In case the file was not found.
        java.io.IOException - - In case there was read/write problem during unpacking.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - IllegalAccessException -
        Since:
        1.2.0

                                 java.util.zip.ZipInputStream zip,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.lang.String permissions,
                                 boolean shouldOverride)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Unpacking a zip file stored as a local file. By specifying the file input stream it will load the zip file and will unzip it into specific directory.
        Parameters:
        destFolder - String - The directory path to the destination.
        zip - ZipInputStream - Input stream to the zip file.
        permissions - String - In case the files don't exist, it will create new file or dir with the following permissions attribute.
        shouldOverride - boolean - Should override the destination files if already exist.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - In case the file was not found.
        java.io.IOException - - In case there was read/write problem during unpacking.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - IllegalAccessException -

      • getZipInputStream

        @Nullable
public static java.util.zip.ZipInputStream getZipInputStream(@NonNull
                                                                       android.content.Context context,
                                                                       @RawRes
                                                                       int id)
        Creates input stream out of a resource file with specific resource ID, stored in the RAW resources package.
        Parameters:
        id - int - The resource id of the file.
        context - Context - The current context.
        Returns:
        ZipInputStream - Returns input stream to the resource file.
        Throws:
        android.content.res.Resources.NotFoundException - - In case the resource was not found.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • getRaw

        @Nullable
public static java.io.InputStream getRaw(android.content.Context context,
                                                   @RawRes
                                                   int id)
        Creates input stream out of a resource file with specific resource ID, stored in the RAW resources package.
        Parameters:
        context - Context - The current context. Null-safe.
        id - int - The resource id of the file.
        Returns:
        InputStream - Returns input stream to the resource file.
        Throws:
        android.content.res.Resources.NotFoundException - - In case the resource was not found.
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • getResIdByName

        @IntegerRes
public static int getResIdByName(android.content.Context context,
                                             java.lang.String resName,
                                             java.lang.String resType)
        Return a resource identifier for the given resource name. A fully qualified resource name is of the form "package:type/entry". The first two components (package and type) are optional if defType and defPackage, respectively, are specified here.
        Parameters:
        context - Context - The current context. Null-safe.
        resName - String - The resource name of the file.
        resType - String - Optional default resource type to find, if "type/" is not included in the name. Can be null to require an explicit type.
        Returns:
        int - Returns the resource id of the file, associated resource identifier. Returns 0 if no such resource was found; the param context, param resName, or param restype is invalid. (0 is not a valid resource ID.)
        Since:
        1.2.0
